Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip and lower wall glazed, with reserved band on latter; in handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of a ram to right (added red on tail, rump, chect and neck; faded added white horn).
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Toronto 939.X.21 (CVA Toronto 1, pl. 34, no. 4-6).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.45)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0525) (Phase 1)
